alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 06 at 3:28PM HST until January 07 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI AND WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .The current northwest swell is beginning to decline with advisory level surf expected tonight along north and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu and Molokai. Advisory level surf will also continue overnight for north facing shores of Maui and west facing shores of the Big Island. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST FRIDAY... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Surf lowering from 18 to 24 feet to 10 to 15 feet along north facing shores. Surf lowering from 14 to 18 feet to 7 to 10 feet along west facing shores. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Kauai, Oahu, and Niihau. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Friday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Expect strong breaking waves, shore break, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult and dangerous.
info.instruction: Beachgoers, swimmers, and surfers should heed all advice given by ocean safety officials and exercise caution. Boaters should expect recreational surfers and body boarders utilizing harbor channels to access surfing areas.

area.areaDesc: Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast
